result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Thomas J Geller was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Will be retro to Administrative suspension to the extend allowed

The Court orders that if the defendant fails to pay the fine and costs within 60 days of the date of conviction or if the Court has authorized monthly payments for the fine and costs and they have not been paid, the Court will enter a judgment and all available enforcement actions may be used to collect this debt.  You must keep the Clerk of Circuit Court informed of your current address until the debt is paid in full.

records.addlTxt: Associated with Charge #1
Case settlement

Defendant Thomas J Geller in court with attorney Terry L. Nussberger.  Rachel Payne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites the case settlement into the court record.  Court instructs on plea questionnaire/waiver of rights.  DE will enter a plea of G, court will accept and find the DE guilty.  Court will accept the recommendations of the parties, will sentence to a fine of $2168.00, 30 months revocation of DL, 30 month installation of IID,  6 months jail.  DE has credit for one day.  Retro to administrative suspension, jail time begins today, will have huber privilege.
Plea/sentencing hearing on March 3, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
filed by Atty Nussberger

Case settlement has been reached, DE will complete the IDIP program, will complete the program in Chippewa County due to work schedule.   Set for 2-02-15 @ 1:00PM, plea/sentencing.
